pr_title: KAFKA-9614: Not initialize topology twice in StreamTask

timeline.message: Merge branch 'trunk' of https://github.com/apache/kafka into KMinor-not-initialize-topology-twice

timeline.bodyText: Seems like maybe we could just get rid of the suspended state entirely, but I guess we plan to do that anyway if/when we remove support for EAGER
timeline.author: ableegoldman

replies.bodyText:
Yes -- from restoring to suspended it is only to update the local checkpoint file, from suspended to restoring there's actually nothing needed. In that sense restoring and suspended states are very similar already, BUT still not exactly the same.
I do hope we get rid of it some time after we remove the EAGER protocol.
replies.author: guozhangwang
